review: With the continued growth of chrome-cast enabled apps, Roku is growing more and more inferior for anyone who isn't completely devoid of either a smart phone or tablet. I'd take simple two-button beaming from a cell app to a Chomecast over the slow and convoluted menu's of a Roku any day, and would expect mom or grandma to have a far easier time with it too. If they want to stay relevant, they really need to accelerate their adoption of casting features. I'm loath to pay yet another 5 dollar fee to PLEX just to play my own local media when I could simply chromecast it from my already purchased Android version, or the numerous free android casting options.I thought having a remote and in-device GUI would make this device more accessible for the less techy members of my household, but it's proven nothing but a hassle.
